explanation: Funds are required to accelerate the development of fundamental 5G dual-use technologies and capabilities (military and civilian), provide the means for industry and academic partners to collaborate with the Department of Defense (DoD) to regularly experiment, test and evaluate (T&E) capabilities (to include red-teaming to address security vulnerabilities), and to develop the capability to dynamically share spectrum (frequencies) in congested and contested environments. This is a new start. The FY 2020 requirement is $436.0 million and will be addressed in future reprogramming requests. The FY 2021 and beyond funding will be submitted in future President's Budget requests. This is a base budget requirement.

Funds are available in officer separation payments due to a projection of approximately 530 fewer involuntary separation payments and approximately 2,000 fewer: lump sum terminal leave payments. This is base budget funding.
